solution_line_template: If we add everything Phillip bought, we will have: ${oranges_cost} + ${apples_cost} + ${candy_cost} = $<<{oranges_cost}+{apples_cost}+{candy_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}
He spent ${total_spent}, and we know that he had ${initial_money} dollars, so now we have to subtract: ${initial_money} - ${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left}
